00020 SDL_Surface* SubSurface(SDL_Surface* sourcesurface, int x, int y, int width, int height) { 
00021         SDL_Rect* area = CreateRect(x, y, width, height); 
00022         
00023         // Set the RGBA mask values.
00024         Uint32 r, g, b, a;
00025         #if SDL_BYTEORDER == SDL_BIG_ENDIAN
00026         r = 0xff000000; g = 0x00ff0000;
00027         b = 0x0000ff00; a = 0x000000ff;
00028         #else
00029         r = 0x000000ff; g = 0x0000ff00;
00030         b = 0x00ff0000; a = 0xff000000;
00031         #endif
00032         
00033         // this is a bit of a mess since alpha doesn't work ; deferring to 3d version since it'll just get rewritten anyway.
00034         
00035         SDL_Surface* subsurface = SDL_DisplayFormat(SDL_CreateRGBSurface(SDL_SRCALPHA, width, height, 32, r, g, b, a));
00036         SDL_BlitSurface(sourcesurface, area, subsurface, 0);
00037         
00038         // Return the newly created surface!
00039         return subsurface;
00040 }

00042 void dump(SDL_Surface *x) {
00043    Uint8 r, g, b, a;
00044    SDL_GetRGBA(((Uint32*)x->pixels)[0], x->format, &r, &g, &b, &a);
00045    printf("RGBA %2x %2x %2x %2x\n", r, g, b, a);
00046 }

00048 /*
00049  * Set the pixel at (x, y) to the given value
00050  * NOTE: The surface must be locked before calling this!
00051  */
00052 void PutPixel(SDL_Surface *surface, int x, int y, Uint32 pixel) {
00053     int bpp = surface->format->BytesPerPixel;
00054     /* Here p is the address to the pixel we want to set */
00055     Uint8 *p = (Uint8 *)surface->pixels + y * surface->pitch + x * bpp;
00056 
00057     switch(bpp) {
00058     case 1:
00059         *p = pixel;
00060         break;
00061 
00062     case 2:
00063         *(Uint16 *)p = pixel;
00064         break;
00065 
00066     case 3:
00067         if(SDL_BYTEORDER == SDL_BIG_ENDIAN) {
00068             p[0] = (pixel >> 16) & 0xff;
00069             p[1] = (pixel >> 8) & 0xff;
00070             p[2] = pixel & 0xff;
00071         } else {
00072             p[0] = pixel & 0xff;
00073             p[1] = (pixel >> 8) & 0xff;
00074             p[2] = (pixel >> 16) & 0xff;
00075         }
00076         break;
00077 
00078     case 4:
00079         *(Uint32 *)p = pixel;
00080         break;
00081     }
00082 }
00083 
00084 /*
00085  * Return the pixel value at (x, y)
00086  * NOTE: The surface must be locked before calling this!
00087  */
00088 Uint32 GetPixel(SDL_Surface *surface, int x, int y) {
00089     int bpp = surface->format->BytesPerPixel;
00090     /* Here p is the address to the pixel we want to retrieve */
00091     Uint8 *p = (Uint8 *)surface->pixels + y * surface->pitch + x * bpp;
00092 
00093     switch(bpp) {
00094     case 1:
00095         return *p;
00096 
00097     case 2:
00098         return *(Uint16 *)p;
00099 
00100     case 3:
00101         if(SDL_BYTEORDER == SDL_BIG_ENDIAN)
00102             return p[0] << 16 | p[1] << 8 | p[2];
00103         else
00104             return p[0] | p[1] << 8 | p[2] << 16;
00105 
00106     case 4:
00107         return *(Uint32 *)p;
00108 
00109     default:
00110         return 0;       /* shouldn't happen, but avoids warnings */
00111     }
00112 }

00114 GLfloat* TransformPointf(GLfloat* m, GLfloat* p) {
00115 
00116         GLfloat* result = new GLfloat[4];
00117 
00118         result[0] = m[ 0]*p[0] + m[ 4]*p[1] + m[ 8]*p[2] + m[12]*p[3]; 
00119         result[1] = m[ 1]*p[0] + m[ 5]*p[1] + m[ 9]*p[2] + m[13]*p[3]; 
00120         result[2] = m[ 2]*p[0] + m[ 6]*p[1] + m[10]*p[2] + m[14]*p[3]; 
00121         result[3] = m[ 3]*p[0] + m[ 7]*p[1] + m[11]*p[2] + m[15]*p[3];
00122 
00123         return result;  
00124         
00125 }
00126 
00127 GLfloat* TransformPoint3fv(GLfloat* m, GLfloat p[3]) {
00128         
00129         GLfloat* t = new GLfloat[4];
00130         t[0] = p[0]; t[1] = p[1]; 
00131         t[2] = p[2]; t[3] = 1; 
00132 
00133         GLfloat* r = TransformPointf(m, t);
00134         
00135         delete [] t;
00136         
00137         GLfloat* result = new GLfloat[3];
00138         result[0] = r[0]; result[1] = r[1]; 
00139         result[2] = r[2];
00140         
00141         delete [] r;
00142         
00143         return result;
00144         
00145 }

00147 void PrintMatrix(GLfloat* m) {
00148         for (int i=0;i<4;i++) {
00149                 cout << "| ";
00150                 for (int j=0;j<4;j++) {
00151                         cout << m[4*j+i] << " ";
00152                 } cout << "|" << endl;
00153         } cout << endl;
00154 }
